Page Contents

    Using Multiple Languages

    In this topic, you will learn how to manage multiple languages for Brightcove Beacon. The multi-language capabilities of Brightcove Beacon apps provide you with the ability to present your content and apps in the native language of your viewers. Your viewers are able to select their language to interact with your content and apps.

    Introduction

    This document contains the following sections:

    • Choose the languages for your apps: Explains the process of choosing the language(s) for your app.
    • What is translated?: Explains what parts of the apps can be translated. Also details what is automatically translated for you and what you have to translate.
    • How your viewers choose a language for the app: Demonstrates three ways your viewers can change the language in which they are using your Brightcove Beacon apps.
    • How your viewers select a video asset language: Shows how your viewers can select the language of a video assets, given the translated version of the video is provided.
    • The following table list the items for which details can be translated. Each section provides instructions and screenshots on how you can provide multi-language assets for videos, pages, series, etc.
      Item Includes details for localizing
      Videos Video titles, metadata, images, subtitles/captions and audio tracks
      Pages Page titles and images
      Playlists Playlist titles
      Series Series titles and images
      Channels Channel titles and images
      Events Event titles and images
      Subscriptions Subscription titles, images and prices

    Choose the languages for your apps

    During the pre-sales process you declared your intent to translate your apps into multiple languages. The possibilities for translation include the app fields and content metadata.

    App translations are accomplished by requesting the translation of the app fields in your app experience. Content translations are the metadata that you enter into the CMS. It includes text data like titles and descriptions and images that contain text.

    Defining the languages you wish to use in your Brightcove Beacon apps is part of the onboarding process. Past the onboarding process, if you choose to start using multiple languages, or wish to add languages for which translations exist, please contact your Brightcove support person. For new language translations please contact Brightcove support.

    What is translated?

    There are two parts of the apps that are/can be translated, they are:

    • Translations of the field names, buttons and descriptions in the apps can be provided by you or can be translated by Brightcove for you.
    • Translations of items you define, for instance page names or video metadata, and images are entered into Brightcove Beacon by you.

    UI translations

    Standard pages, like the Settings page are provided in the languages you specify. For instance, here is the Settings page in both English and German:

    Non-standard page UI translations

    You use Beacon Classic UI to translate non-Brightcove Beacon UI elements. For instance, the following screenshots show the UI for adding translated page names and movie information:

    How your viewers choose a language for the app

    There are three ways your viewers can choose the language to use in the app. They are:

    • Select the language in the Settings page
    • Set the language of the browser (if applicable)
    • Set the language for your device (if applicable)

    Change the language in the app

    Viewers can choose the language in the Brightcove Beacon app itself. The following shows the process the viewer would follow using the Settings page to change the app language from English to German:

    Set the preferred language in the browser

    If a viewer sets a preferred language in a browser, and that language is supported in the Brightcove Beacon app, the app will automatically use that language. The viewer would not have to set the language in the Settings standard page.

    Note: If a language is set in the actual Brightcove Beacon app, that will override browser settings.

    All popular browsers have a way to set the preferred language. As an example, this is how in Chrome the setting is done in the Advanced section of the Settings option:

    Set the language on your device

    For instance, on an iPhone go to Settings → General → Language & Region

    Note: If a language is set in the actual Brightcove Beacon app, that will override device settings.

    How your viewers select a video asset language

    In addition to languages available in the apps, you might have multi-lingual captions and audio tracks available for your video assets. If the video does have multiple languages available, the viewer selects the desired language during video playback. A gear icon is available during playback, and clicking that icon displays a dialog and the viewer can choose the language for subtitles and/or audio track, as shown here:

    Localizing Video Information

    There are many items you can localize around videos. Details for each are provided here:

    Define video metadata languages

    The basic process for localizing video metadata is:

    • Configure the desired language in Beacons Studio's Admin module.
    • In the video properties page, select the language for which you want to enter localized metadata.
    • Enter the localized metadata.
    For further information on using multi-lingual metadata see the Working with Multi-Lingual Metadata document.

    The first step for using multi-lingual metadata is selecting the language in which you want metadata in Beacon Studio by navigating to Admin → Language Settings. You first add the language then save it, as shown here:

    1. Add the language
    2. Save the language

    Video metadata

    This task is performed in Beacon Studio. Go the the Media module then click on the video to which you wish to add multi-lingual metadata. To actually enter the metadata navigate to Overview → Video Information then select the language and finally enter the metadata.

    1. Select the language
    2. Enter the metadata

    Video images

    This task is performed in Beacon Studio. Go the the Media module then click on the video to which you wish to add localized images. To actually supply the localized images navigate to Images then select the language and finally upload the images.

    Video subtitles/captions

    This task is performed in Beacon Studio. Go the the Media module then click on the video to which you wish to add multi-lingual subtitles/captions. To actually supply the subtitles/captions navigate to Video and Tracks → Text Tracks, click Edit then complete the form.

    For complete details see the Adding Captions to Videos document.
    1. Select the language
    2. Complete the form for the new ubtitles/captions

    Audio tracks

    This task is performed in Beacon Studio. Go the the Media module then click on the video to which you wish to add audio tracks. To actually supply the audio tracks navigate to Video and Tracks → Audio Tracks section, click Edit → Add Audio Track then complete the form.

    For complete details see the Adding Audio Tracks to Videos document.
    1. Select the language
    2. Complete the form to add a new audio track

    Pages

    Pages can have their titles and associated images localized. In Beacon Classic UI, navigate to the Pages section and click on the page you wish to alter. In this example information for the Home page is localized.

    Page Titles

    Page images

    Not possible in Beacon Studio

    Playlists

    Playlists can only have their titles localized.

    Playlist titles

    Series

    Series titles

    Series images

    Channels

    Channel titles

    Not possible in Beacon Studio

    Channel images

    Not possible in Beacon Studio

    Events

    Event titles

    Not possible in Beacon Studio

    Event images

    Not possible in Beacon Studio

    Subscriptions

    Subscription titles

    Not possible in Beacon Studio

    Subscription images

    Not possible in Beacon Studio

    Subscription prices

    Not possible in Beacon Studio
